body_content.explanation: the speed at which light travels in a vacuum (= a space in which there is no matter) and which is considered to be the maximum speed according to known physical laws:
examples: The speed of light is 300 million metres per second.
Subatomic particles are accelerated around a four-mile ring and smashed together at nearly the speed of light.
Cameras captured the particles as they fell to the ground near the speed of light.
He delivered the speech at something approaching the speed of light.
In class, she picked up everything with the speed of light.
